description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cvt2f","text":"Optmisation of sample multiplexing oligos by scRNA-Seq is costly and time consuming. A cheaper and faster method is to use a flow cytometry read-out with fluorescent detection oligonucleotides.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6k4em","text":"This method can also be used to mix samples with different fluorescently labelled oligos and investigate signal swapping.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"81i6e","text":"Marlon Stoeckius, Shiwei Zheng, Brian Houck-Loomis, Stephanie Hao, Bertrand Z Yeung,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdnaf","text":"William M Mauck, Peter Smibert, and Rahul Satija. Cell hashing with barcoded antibodies","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"alm3a","text":"enables multiplexing and doublet detection for single cell genomics. Genome biology, 19","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mdls","text":"(1):1–12, 2018.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pd5t","text":"Christopher S McGinnis, David M Patterson, Juliane Winkler, Daniel N Conrad, Marco Y","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bj8mj","text":"Hein, Vasudha Srivastava, Jennifer L Hu, Lyndsay M Murrow, Jonathan S Weissman, Zena","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7pp4","text":"Werb, et al. Multi-seq: sample multiplexing for single-cell rna sequencing using lipid-tagged","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40jke","text":"indices. Nature methods, 16(7):619–626, 2019","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7eqms","text":"Mix anchor and barcode strands in 1:1 molar ratio in PBS (without FBS or BSA at 2 µM concentration (10X stock).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"af7sf","text":"This is 6uL 50uM anchor LMO, and 15uL 10uM barcode oligo to 129uL plain PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"akcuc","text":"Make one unique barcode solution per sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e5ook","text":"Total 25 µL per sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bvccf","text":"Make a 10X solution of the Co-Anchor in PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"en2p8","text":"Add 3uL 50uM co-anchor to 141uL plain PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"de9ji","text":"Add 6uL 100uM fluorescent detection oligo. For example:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"429h8","text":"Alexa 647 feature barcode 2 detection oligo.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9nru2","text":"For CellPlex and Hashtag antibody the reagent comes ready to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4ecst","text":"Prepare a dilution series for titration if desired","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1sfmu","text":"I use suspension cell lines to titrate cell multiplexing oligos so the sample preparation is easy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6d6a","text":"Prepare a single-cell suspension of the sample to be tested.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"32ko0","text":"Wash cells once in plain PBS without additives. I centrifuge suspension cell lines at 400xg.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e31f2","text":"Resuspend in PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ig63","text":"Count cells and transfer 100k to 1M cells (preferably 500k) into a 1.5mL tube for labelling","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3p1i","text":"This is largely based on original protocols but with the addition of a fluorescent secondary oligo.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"elcml","text":"Resuspend cells in 180uL of plain PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"am11i","text":"Use a FACS analyser to compare the signal of labelled samples to a control sample where only the fluorescent detection oligo has been added.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mef1","text":"If you have replicate labelled samples with different fluorescent detection oligos, you may combine them at this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"uk75","text":"Add DAPI to a final concentration of 0.1ug/mL (1/100 stock tube).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bbjqf","text":"Add 20 µL 10X Anchor:Barcode solution and pipette gently to mix 10 – 15 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1v6vk","text":"Incubate on ice for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"btiof","text":"Add 20 µL Co-Anchor solution and pipette gently to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ej4n2","text":"Incubate 5 minutes longer on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9pfg1","text":"Add 1.5mL of 1% BSA in PBS (ice cold) to quench.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2cp5b","text":"Add 1.5mL of 1% BSA in PBS (ice cold) to quench.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8ls0s","text":"Add 1mL of 1% BSA in PBS (ice cold) to quench.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5ktrd","text":"Centrifuge cells at 4°C 400xg 5min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dftnk","text":"Resuspend cells in the remaining 100uL of supernatant then transfer to a new 1.5mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"34ema","text":"Add 1.9mL 1% BSA in PBS and spin 5 minutes 400g at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f3qkk","text":"Repeat wash 2 more times for a total of 3 washes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a78gb","text":"Resuspend cells in 500 µL of PBS + 1% BSA and transfer to 5mL polystyrene  FACS tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d0m4m","text":"Gate for debris, single cells and viable cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"559kg","text":"Aquire at least 10,000 viable cells per test.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6q968","text":"Analyse with relevant software.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f45ch","text":"It is highly recomended to label in at least duplicate. On these occasions I label the other replicate with a Alexa 594 detection oligo and mix immediately before FACS analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Optimising sample multiplexing oligos by flow cytometry
title_html: Optimising sample multiplexing oligos by flow cytometry
